summary.long: Judges is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: After the death of Joshua, the people of Israel inquired of the Lord, “Who shall go up first for us against the Canaanites, to fight against them?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said, “Judah shall go up; behold, I have given the land into his hand.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Judah said to Simeon his brother, “Come up with me into the territory allotted to me, that we may fight against the Canaanites. And I likewise will go with you into the territory allotted to you.” So Simeon went with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Judah went up and the Lord gave the Canaanites and the Perizzites into their hand, and they defeated 10,000 of them at Bezek.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They found Adoni-bezek at Bezek and fought against him and defeated the Canaanites and the Perizzites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Adoni-bezek fled, but they pursued him and caught him and cut off his thumbs and his big toes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Adoni-bezek said, “Seventy kings with their thumbs and their big toes cut off used to pick up scraps under my table. As I have done, so God has repaid me.” And they brought him to Jerusalem, and he died there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the men of Judah fought against Jerusalem and captured it and struck it with the edge of the sword and set the city on fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And afterward the men of Judah went down to fight against the Canaanites who lived in the hill country, in the Negeb, and in the lowland.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Judah went against the Canaanites who lived in Hebron (now the name of Hebron was formerly Kiriath-arba), and they defeated Sheshai and Ahiman and Talmai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From there they went against the inhabitants of Debir. The name of Debir was formerly Kiriath-sepher.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Caleb said, “He who attacks Kiriath-sepher and captures it, I will give him Achsah my daughter for a wife.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Othniel the son of Kenaz, Caleb's younger brother, captured it. And he gave him Achsah his daughter for a wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When she came to him, she urged him to ask her father for a field. And she dismounted from her donkey, and Caleb said to her, “What do you want?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She said to him, “Give me a blessing. Since you have set me in the land of the Negeb, give me also springs of water.” And Caleb gave her the upper springs and the lower springs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the descendants of the Kenite, Moses' father-in-law, went up with the people of Judah from the city of palms into the wilderness of Judah, which lies in the Negeb near Arad, and they went and settled with the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Judah went with Simeon his brother, and they defeated the Canaanites who inhabited Zephath and devoted it to destruction. So the name of the city was called Hormah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judah also captured Gaza with its territory, and Ashkelon with its territory, and Ekron with its territory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord was with Judah, and he took possession of the hill country, but he could not drive out the inhabitants of the plain because they had chariots of iron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Hebron was given to Caleb, as Moses had said. And he drove out from it the three sons of Anak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the people of Benjamin did not drive out the Jebusites who lived in Jerusalem, so the Jebusites have lived with the people of Benjamin in Jerusalem to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The house of Joseph also went up against Bethel, and the Lord was with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the house of Joseph scouted out Bethel. (Now the name of the city was formerly Luz.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the spies saw a man coming out of the city, and they said to him, “Please show us the way into the city, and we will deal kindly with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he showed them the way into the city. And they struck the city with the edge of the sword, but they let the man and all his family go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the man went to the land of the Hittites and built a city and called its name Luz. That is its name to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Manasseh did not drive out the inhabitants of Beth-shean and its villages, or Taanach and its villages, or the inhabitants of Dor and its villages, or the inhabitants of Ibleam and its villages, or the inhabitants of Megiddo and its villages, for the Canaanites persisted in dwelling in that land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Israel grew strong, they put the Canaanites to forced labor, but did not drive them out completely.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Ephraim did not drive out the Canaanites who lived in Gezer, so the Canaanites lived in Gezer among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zebulun did not drive out the inhabitants of Kitron, or the inhabitants of Nahalol, so the Canaanites lived among them, but became subject to forced labor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Asher did not drive out the inhabitants of Acco, or the inhabitants of Sidon or of Ahlab or of Achzib or of Helbah or of Aphik or of Rehob,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so the Asherites lived among the Canaanites, the inhabitants of the land, for they did not drive them out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Naphtali did not drive out the inhabitants of Beth-shemesh, or the inhabitants of Beth-anath, so they lived among the Canaanites, the inhabitants of the land. Nevertheless, the inhabitants of Beth-shemesh and of Beth-anath became subject to forced labor for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Amorites pressed the people of Dan back into the hill country, for they did not allow them to come down to the plain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Amorites persisted in dwelling in Mount Heres, in Aijalon, and in Shaalbim, but the hand of the house of Joseph rested heavily on them, and they became subject to forced labor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the border of the Amorites ran from the ascent of Akrabbim, from Sela and upward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the angel of the Lord went up from Gilgal to Bochim. And he said, “I brought you up from Egypt and brought you into the land that I swore to give to your fathers. I said, ‘I will never break my covenant with you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you shall make no covenant with the inhabitants of this land; you shall break down their altars.’ But you have not obeyed my voice. What is this you have done?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So now I say, I will not drive them out before you, but they shall become thorns in your sides, and their gods shall be a snare to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as the angel of the Lord spoke these words to all the people of Israel, the people lifted up their voices and wept.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they called the name of that place Bochim. And they sacrificed there to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Joshua dismissed the people, the people of Israel went each to his inheritance to take possession of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people served the Lord all the days of Joshua, and all the days of the elders who outlived Joshua, who had seen all the great work that the Lord had done for Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joshua the son of Nun, the servant of the Lord, died at the age of 110 years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they buried him within the boundaries of his inheritance in Timnath-heres, in the hill country of Ephraim, north of the mountain of Gaash.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all that generation also were gathered to their fathers. And there arose another generation after them who did not know the Lord or the work that he had done for Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people of Israel did what was evil in the sight of the Lord and served the Baals.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they abandoned the Lord, the God of their fathers, who had brought them out of the land of Egypt. They went after other gods, from among the gods of the peoples who were around them, and bowed down to them. And they provoked the Lord to anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They abandoned the Lord and served the Baals and the Ashtaroth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the anger of the Lord was kindled against Israel, and he gave them over to plunderers, who plundered them. And he sold them into the hand of their surrounding enemies, so that they could no longer withstand their enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whenever they marched out, the hand of the Lord was against them for harm, as the Lord had warned, and as the Lord had sworn to them. And they were in terrible distress.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord raised up judges, who saved them out of the hand of those who plundered them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet they did not listen to their judges, for they whored after other gods and bowed down to them. They soon turned aside from the way in which their fathers had walked, who had obeyed the commandments of the Lord, and they did not do so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whenever the Lord raised up judges for them, the Lord was with the judge, and he saved them from the hand of their enemies all the days of the judge. For the Lord was moved to pity by their groaning because of those who afflicted and oppressed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But whenever the judge died, they turned back and were more corrupt than their fathers, going after other gods, serving them and bowing down to them. They did not drop any of their practices or their stubborn ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the anger of the Lord was kindled against Israel, and he said, “Because this people have transgressed my covenant that I commanded their fathers and have not obeyed my voice,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will no longer drive out before them any of the nations that Joshua left when he died,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in order to test Israel by them, whether they will take care to walk in the way of the Lord as their fathers did, or not.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord left those nations, not driving them out quickly, and he did not give them into the hand of Joshua.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now these are the nations that the Lord left, to test Israel by them, that is, all in Israel who had not experienced all the wars in Canaan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was only in order that the generations of the people of Israel might know war, to teach war to those who had not known it before.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the nations: the five lords of the Philistines and all the Canaanites and the Sidonians and the Hivites who lived on Mount Lebanon, from Mount Baal-hermon as far as Lebo-hamath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were for the testing of Israel, to know whether Israel would obey the commandments of the Lord, which he commanded their fathers by the hand of Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the people of Israel lived among the Canaanites, the Hittites, the Amorites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And their daughters they took to themselves for wives, and their own daughters they gave to their sons, and they served their gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people of Israel did what was evil in the sight of the Lord. They forgot the Lord their God and served the Baals and the Asheroth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore the anger of the Lord was kindled against Israel, and he sold them into the hand of Cushan-rishathaim king of Mesopotamia. And the people of Israel served Cushan-rishathaim eight years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the people of Israel cried out to the Lord, the Lord raised up a deliverer for the people of Israel, who saved them, Othniel the son of Kenaz, Caleb's younger brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Spirit of the Lord was upon him, and he judged Israel. He went out to war, and the Lord gave Cushan-rishathaim king of Mesopotamia into his hand. And his hand prevailed over Cushan-rishathaim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the land had rest forty years. Then Othniel the son of Kenaz died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people of Israel again did what was evil in the sight of the Lord, and the Lord strengthened Eglon the king of Moab against Israel, because they had done what was evil in the sight of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He gathered to himself the Ammonites and the Amalekites, and went and defeated Israel. And they took possession of the city of palms.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people of Israel served Eglon the king of Moab eighteen years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the people of Israel cried out to the Lord, and the Lord raised up for them a deliverer, Ehud, the son of Gera, the Benjaminite, a left-handed man. The people of Israel sent tribute by him to Eglon the king of Moab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Ehud made for himself a sword with two edges, a cubit in length, and he bound it on his right thigh under his clothes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he presented the tribute to Eglon king of Moab. Now Eglon was a very fat man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Ehud had finished presenting the tribute, he sent away the people who carried the tribute.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he himself turned back at the idols near Gilgal and said, “I have a secret message for you, O king.” And he commanded, “Silence.” And all his attendants went out from his presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Ehud came to him as he was sitting alone in his cool roof chamber. And Ehud said, “I have a message from God for you.” And he arose from his seat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Ehud reached with his left hand, took the sword from his right thigh, and thrust it into his belly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the hilt also went in after the blade, and the fat closed over the blade, for he did not pull the sword out of his belly; and the dung came out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Ehud went out into the porch and closed the doors of the roof chamber behind him and locked them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had gone, the servants came, and when they saw that the doors of the roof chamber were locked, they thought, “Surely he is relieving himself in the closet of the cool chamber.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they waited till they were embarrassed. But when he still did not open the doors of the roof chamber, they took the key and opened them, and there lay their lord dead on the floor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ehud escaped while they delayed, and he passed beyond the idols and escaped to Seirah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he arrived, he sounded the trumpet in the hill country of Ephraim. Then the people of Israel went down with him from the hill country, and he was their leader.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “Follow after me, for the Lord has given your enemies the Moabites into your hand.” So they went down after him and seized the fords of the Jordan against the Moabites and did not allow anyone to pass over.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they killed at that time about 10,000 of the Moabites, all strong, able-bodied men; not a man escaped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moab was subdued that day under the hand of Israel. And the land had rest for eighty years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After him was Shamgar the son of Anath, who killed 600 of the Philistines with an oxgoad, and he also saved Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people of Israel again did what was evil in the sight of the Lord after Ehud died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord sold them into the hand of Jabin king of Canaan, who reigned in Hazor. The commander of his army was Sisera, who lived in Harosheth-hagoyim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the people of Israel cried out to the Lord for help, for he had 900 chariots of iron and he oppressed the people of Israel cruelly for twenty years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Deborah, a prophetess, the wife of Lappidoth, was judging Israel at that time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She used to sit under the palm of Deborah between Ramah and Bethel in the hill country of Ephraim, and the people of Israel came up to her for judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She sent and summoned Barak the son of Abinoam from Kedesh-naphtali and said to him, “Has not the Lord, the God of Israel, commanded you, ‘Go, gather your men at Mount Tabor, taking 10,000 from the people of Naphtali and the people of Zebulun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will draw out Sisera, the general of Jabin's army, to meet you by the river Kishon with his chariots and his troops, and I will give him into your hand’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Barak said to her, “If you will go with me, I will go, but if you will not go with me, I will not go.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she said, “I will surely go with you. Nevertheless, the road on which you are going will not lead to your glory, for the Lord will sell Sisera into the hand of a woman.” Then Deborah arose and went with Barak to Kedesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Barak called out Zebulun and Naphtali to Kedesh. And 10,000 men went up at his heels, and Deborah went up with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Heber the Kenite had separated from the Kenites, the descendants of Hobab the father-in-law of Moses, and had pitched his tent as far away as the oak in Zaanannim, which is near Kedesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Sisera was told that Barak the son of Abinoam had gone up to Mount Tabor,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sisera called out all his chariots, 900 chariots of iron, and all the men who were with him, from Harosheth-hagoyim to the river Kishon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Deborah said to Barak, “Up! For this is the day in which the Lord has given Sisera into your hand. Does not the Lord go out before you?” So Barak went down from Mount Tabor with 10,000 men following him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord routed Sisera and all his chariots and all his army before Barak by the edge of the sword. And Sisera got down from his chariot and fled away on foot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Barak pursued the chariots and the army to Harosheth-hagoyim, and all the army of Sisera fell by the edge of the sword; not a man was left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Sisera fled away on foot to the tent of Jael, the wife of Heber the Kenite, for there was peace between Jabin the king of Hazor and the house of Heber the Kenite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jael came out to meet Sisera and said to him, “Turn aside, my lord; turn aside to me; do not be afraid.” So he turned aside to her into the tent, and she covered him with a rug.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to her, “Please give me a little water to drink, for I am thirsty.” So she opened a skin of milk and gave him a drink and covered him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to her, “Stand at the opening of the tent, and if any man comes and asks you, ‘Is anyone here?’ say, ‘No.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jael the wife of Heber took a tent peg, and took a hammer in her hand. Then she went softly to him and drove the peg into his temple until it went down into the ground while he was lying fast asleep from weariness. So he died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, as Barak was pursuing Sisera, Jael went out to meet him and said to him, “Come, and I will show you the man whom you are seeking.” So he went in to her tent, and there lay Sisera dead, with the tent peg in his temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So on that day God subdued Jabin the king of Canaan before the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the hand of the people of Israel pressed harder and harder against Jabin the king of Canaan, until they destroyed Jabin king of Canaan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then sang Deborah and Barak the son of Abinoam on that day:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“That the leaders took the lead in Israel,
    that the people offered themselves willingly,
    bless the Lord!
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“Lord, when you went out from Seir,
    when you marched from the region of Edom,
the earth trembled
    and the heavens dropped,
    yes, the clouds dropped water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The mountains quaked before the Lord,
    even Sinai before the Lord, the God of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“In the days of Shamgar, son of Anath,
    in the days of Jael, the highways were abandoned,
    and travelers kept to the byways.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
When new gods were chosen,
    then war was in the gates.
Was shield or spear to be seen
    among forty thousand in Israel?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My heart goes out to the commanders of Israel
    who offered themselves willingly among the people.
    Bless the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Tell of it, you who ride on white donkeys,
    you who sit on rich carpets
    and you who walk by the way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To the sound of musicians at the watering places,
    there they repeat the righteous triumphs of the Lord,
    the righteous triumphs of his villagers in Israel.
“Then down to the gates marched the people of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Awake, awake, Deborah!
    Awake, awake, break out in a song!
Arise, Barak, lead away your captives,
    O son of Abinoam.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then down marched the remnant of the noble;
    the people of the Lord marched down for me against the mighty.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
the princes of Issachar came with Deborah,
    and Issachar faithful to Barak;
    into the valley they rushed at his heels.
Among the clans of Reuben
    there were great searchings of heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why did you sit still among the sheepfolds,
    to hear the whistling for the flocks?
Among the clans of Reuben
    there were great searchings of heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Gilead stayed beyond the Jordan;
    and Dan, why did he stay with the ships?
Asher sat still at the coast of the sea,
    staying by his landings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Zebulun is a people who risked their lives to the death;
    Naphtali, too, on the heights of the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
From heaven the stars fought,
    from their courses they fought against Sisera.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The torrent Kishon swept them away,
    the ancient torrent, the torrent Kishon.
    March on, my soul, with might!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Then loud beat the horses' hoofs
    with the galloping, galloping of his steeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Curse Meroz, says the angel of the Lord,
    curse its inhabitants thoroughly,
because they did not come to the help of the Lord,
    to the help of the Lord against the mighty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Most blessed of women be Jael,
    the wife of Heber the Kenite,
    of tent-dwelling women most blessed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He asked for water and she gave him milk;
    she brought him curds in a noble's bowl.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“Out of the window she peered,
    the mother of Sisera wailed through the lattice:
‘Why is his chariot so long in coming?
    Why tarry the hoofbeats of his chariots?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Her wisest princesses answer,
    indeed, she answers herself,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Have they not found and divided the spoil?—
    A womb or two for every man;
spoil of dyed materials for Sisera,
    spoil of dyed materials embroidered,
    two pieces of dyed work embroidered for the neck as spoil?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“So may all your enemies perish, O Lord!
    But your friends be like the sun as he rises in his might.”
And the land had rest for forty years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people of Israel did what was evil in the sight of the Lord, and the Lord gave them into the hand of Midian seven years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the hand of Midian overpowered Israel, and because of Midian the people of Israel made for themselves the dens that are in the mountains and the caves and the strongholds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whenever the Israelites planted crops, the Midianites and the Amalekites and the people of the East would come up against them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They would encamp against them and devour the produce of the land, as far as Gaza, and leave no sustenance in Israel and no sheep or ox or donkey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they would come up with their livestock and their tents; they would come like locusts in number—both they and their camels could not be counted—so that they laid waste the land as they came in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Israel was brought very low because of Midian. And the people of Israel cried out for help to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the people of Israel cried out to the Lord on account of the Midianites,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the Lord sent a prophet to the people of Israel. And he said to them, “Thus says the Lord, the God of Israel: I led you up from Egypt and brought you out of the house of slavery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I delivered you from the hand of the Egyptians and from the hand of all who oppressed you, and drove them out before you and gave you their land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I said to you, ‘I am the Lord your God; you shall not fear the gods of the Amorites in whose land you dwell.’ But you have not obeyed my voice.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the angel of the Lord came and sat under the terebinth at Ophrah, which belonged to Joash the Abiezrite, while his son Gideon was beating out wheat in the winepress to hide it from the Midianites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the angel of the Lord appeared to him and said to him, “The Lord is with you, O mighty man of valor.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Gideon said to him, “Please, my lord, if the Lord is with us, why then has all this happened to us? And where are all his wonderful deeds that our fathers recounted to us, saying, ‘Did not the Lord bring us up from Egypt?’ But now the Lord has forsaken us and given us into the hand of Midian.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord turned to him and said, “Go in this might of yours and save Israel from the hand of Midian; do not I send you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to him, “Please, Lord, how can I save Israel? Behold, my clan is the weakest in Manasseh, and I am the least in my father's house.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to him, “But I will be with you, and you shall strike the Midianites as one man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to him, “If now I have found favor in your eyes, then show me a sign that it is you who speak with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Please do not depart from here until I come to you and bring out my present and set it before you.” And he said, “I will stay till you return.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Gideon went into his house and prepared a young goat and unleavened cakes from an ephah of flour. The meat he put in a basket, and the broth he put in a pot, and brought them to him under the terebinth and presented them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the angel of God said to him, “Take the meat and the unleavened cakes, and put them on this rock, and pour the broth over them.” And he did so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the angel of the Lord reached out the tip of the staff that was in his hand and touched the meat and the unleavened cakes. And fire sprang up from the rock and consumed the meat and the unleavened cakes. And the angel of the Lord vanished from his sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Gideon perceived that he was the angel of the Lord. And Gideon said, “Alas, O Lord God! For now I have seen the angel of the Lord face to face.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord said to him, “Peace be to you. Do not fear; you shall not die.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Gideon built an altar there to the Lord and called it, The Lord Is Peace. To this day it still stands at Ophrah, which belongs to the Abiezrites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That night the Lord said to him, “Take your father's bull, and the second bull seven years old, and pull down the altar of Baal that your father has, and cut down the Asherah that is beside it
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and build an altar to the Lord your God on the top of the stronghold here, with stones laid in due order. Then take the second bull and offer it as a burnt offering with the wood of the Asherah that you shall cut down.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Gideon took ten men of his servants and did as the Lord had told him. But because he was too afraid of his family and the men of the town to do it by day, he did it by night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the men of the town rose early in the morning, behold, the altar of Baal was broken down, and the Asherah beside it was cut down, and the second bull was offered on the altar that had been built.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said to one another, “Who has done this thing?” And after they had searched and inquired, they said, “Gideon the son of Joash has done this thing.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the men of the town said to Joash, “Bring out your son, that he may die, for he has broken down the altar of Baal and cut down the Asherah beside it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Joash said to all who stood against him, “Will you contend for Baal? Or will you save him? Whoever contends for him shall be put to death by morning. If he is a god, let him contend for himself, because his altar has been broken down.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore on that day Gideon was called Jerubbaal, that is to say, “Let Baal contend against him,” because he broke down his altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now all the Midianites and the Amalekites and the people of the East came together, and they crossed the Jordan and encamped in the Valley of Jezreel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Spirit of the Lord clothed Gideon, and he sounded the trumpet, and the Abiezrites were called out to follow him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he sent messengers throughout all Manasseh, and they too were called out to follow him. And he sent messengers to Asher, Zebulun, and Naphtali, and they went up to meet them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Gideon said to God, “If you will save Israel by my hand, as you have said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: behold, I am laying a fleece of wool on the threshing floor. If there is dew on the fleece alone, and it is dry on all the ground, then I shall know that you will save Israel by my hand, as you have said.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it was so. When he rose early next morning and squeezed the fleece, he wrung enough dew from the fleece to fill a bowl with water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Gideon said to God, “Let not your anger burn against me; let me speak just once more. Please let me test just once more with the fleece. Please let it be dry on the fleece only, and on all the ground let there be dew.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God did so that night; and it was dry on the fleece only, and on all the ground there was dew.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jerubbaal (that is, Gideon) and all the people who were with him rose early and encamped beside the spring of Harod. And the camp of Midian was north of them, by the hill of Moreh, in the valley.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Gideon, “The people with you are too many for me to give the Midianites into their hand, lest Israel boast over me, saying, ‘My own hand has saved me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore proclaim in the ears of the people, saying, ‘Whoever is fearful and trembling, let him return home and hurry away from Mount Gilead.’” Then 22,000 of the people returned, and 10,000 remained.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to Gideon, “The people are still too many. Take them down to the water, and I will test them for you there, and anyone of whom I say to you, ‘This one shall go with you,’ shall go with you, and anyone of whom I say to you, ‘This one shall not go with you,’ shall not go.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he brought the people down to the water. And the Lord said to Gideon, “Every one who laps the water with his tongue, as a dog laps, you shall set by himself. Likewise, every one who kneels down to drink.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the number of those who lapped, putting their hands to their mouths, was 300 men, but all the rest of the people knelt down to drink water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to Gideon, “With the 300 men who lapped I will save you and give the Midianites into your hand, and let all the others go every man to his home.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the people took provisions in their hands, and their trumpets. And he sent all the rest of Israel every man to his tent, but retained the 300 men. And the camp of Midian was below him in the valley.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That same night the Lord said to him, “Arise, go down against the camp, for I have given it into your hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you are afraid to go down, go down to the camp with Purah your servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall hear what they say, and afterward your hands shall be strengthened to go down against the camp.” Then he went down with Purah his servant to the outposts of the armed men who were in the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Midianites and the Amalekites and all the people of the East lay along the valley like locusts in abundance, and their camels were without number, as the sand that is on the seashore in abundance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Gideon came, behold, a man was telling a dream to his comrade. And he said, “Behold, I dreamed a dream, and behold, a cake of barley bread tumbled into the camp of Midian and came to the tent and struck it so that it fell and turned it upside down, so that the tent lay flat.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his comrade answered, “This is no other than the sword of Gideon the son of Joash, a man of Israel; God has given into his hand Midian and all the camp.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as Gideon heard the telling of the dream and its interpretation, he worshiped. And he returned to the camp of Israel and said, “Arise, for the Lord has given the host of Midian into your hand.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he divided the 300 men into three companies and put trumpets into the hands of all of them and empty jars, with torches inside the jars.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “Look at me, and do likewise. When I come to the outskirts of the camp, do as I do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I blow the trumpet, I and all who are with me, then blow the trumpets also on every side of all the camp and shout, ‘For the Lord and for Gideon.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Gideon and the hundred men who were with him came to the outskirts of the camp at the beginning of the middle watch, when they had just set the watch. And they blew the trumpets and smashed the jars that were in their hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the three companies blew the trumpets and broke the jars. They held in their left hands the torches, and in their right hands the trumpets to blow. And they cried out, “A sword for the Lord and for Gideon!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every man stood in his place around the camp, and all the army ran. They cried out and fled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they blew the 300 trumpets, the Lord set every man's sword against his comrade and against all the army. And the army fled as far as Beth-shittah toward Zererah, as far as the border of Abel-meholah, by Tabbath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the men of Israel were called out from Naphtali and from Asher and from all Manasseh, and they pursued after Midian.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Gideon sent messengers throughout all the hill country of Ephraim, saying, “Come down against the Midianites and capture the waters against them, as far as Beth-barah, and also the Jordan.” So all the men of Ephraim were called out, and they captured the waters as far as Beth-barah, and also the Jordan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they captured the two princes of Midian, Oreb and Zeeb. They killed Oreb at the rock of Oreb, and Zeeb they killed at the winepress of Zeeb. Then they pursued Midian, and they brought the heads of Oreb and Zeeb to Gideon across the Jordan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the men of Ephraim said to him, “What is this that you have done to us, not to call us when you went to fight against Midian?” And they accused him fiercely.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “What have I done now in comparison with you? Is not the gleaning of the grapes of Ephraim better than the grape harvest of Abiezer?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God has given into your hands the princes of Midian, Oreb and Zeeb. What have I been able to do in comparison with you?” Then their anger against him subsided when he said this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Gideon came to the Jordan and crossed over, he and the 300 men who were with him, exhausted yet pursuing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he said to the men of Succoth, “Please give loaves of bread to the people who follow me, for they are exhausted, and I am pursuing after Zebah and Zalmunna, the kings of Midian.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the officials of Succoth said, “Are the hands of Zebah and Zalmunna already in your hand, that we should give bread to your army?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Gideon said, “Well then, when the Lord has given Zebah and Zalmunna into my hand, I will flail your flesh with the thorns of the wilderness and with briers.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And from there he went up to Penuel, and spoke to them in the same way, and the men of Penuel answered him as the men of Succoth had answered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to the men of Penuel, “When I come again in peace, I will break down this tower.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Zebah and Zalmunna were in Karkor with their army, about 15,000 men, all who were left of all the army of the people of the East, for there had fallen 120,000 men who drew the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Gideon went up by the way of the tent dwellers east of Nobah and Jogbehah and attacked the army, for the army felt secure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Zebah and Zalmunna fled, and he pursued them and captured the two kings of Midian, Zebah and Zalmunna, and he threw all the army into a panic.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Gideon the son of Joash returned from the battle by the ascent of Heres.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he captured a young man of Succoth and questioned him. And he wrote down for him the officials and elders of Succoth, seventy-seven men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he came to the men of Succoth and said, “Behold Zebah and Zalmunna, about whom you taunted me, saying, ‘Are the hands of Zebah and Zalmunna already in your hand, that we should give bread to your men who are exhausted?’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he took the elders of the city, and he took thorns of the wilderness and briers and with them taught the men of Succoth a lesson.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he broke down the tower of Penuel and killed the men of the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to Zebah and Zalmunna, “Where are the men whom you killed at Tabor?” They answered, “As you are, so were they. Every one of them resembled the son of a king.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “They were my brothers, the sons of my mother. As the Lord lives, if you had saved them alive, I would not kill you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he said to Jether his firstborn, “Rise and kill them!” But the young man did not draw his sword, for he was afraid, because he was still a young man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Zebah and Zalmunna said, “Rise yourself and fall upon us, for as the man is, so is his strength.” And Gideon arose and killed Zebah and Zalmunna, and he took the crescent ornaments that were on the necks of their camels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the men of Israel said to Gideon, “Rule over us, you and your son and your grandson also, for you have saved us from the hand of Midian.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Gideon said to them, “I will not rule over you, and my son will not rule over you; the Lord will rule over you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Gideon said to them, “Let me make a request of you: every one of you give me the earrings from his spoil.” (For they had golden earrings, because they were Ishmaelites.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they answered, “We will willingly give them.” And they spread a cloak, and every man threw in it the earrings of his spoil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the weight of the golden earrings that he requested was 1,700 shekels of gold, besides the crescent ornaments and the pendants and the purple garments worn by the kings of Midian, and besides the collars that were around the necks of their camels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Gideon made an ephod of it and put it in his city, in Ophrah. And all Israel whored after it there, and it became a snare to Gideon and to his family.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Midian was subdued before the people of Israel, and they raised their heads no more. And the land had rest forty years in the days of Gideon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jerubbaal the son of Joash went and lived in his own house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Gideon had seventy sons, his own offspring, for he had many wives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his concubine who was in Shechem also bore him a son, and he called his name Abimelech.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Gideon the son of Joash died in a good old age and was buried in the tomb of Joash his father, at Ophrah of the Abiezrites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as Gideon died, the people of Israel turned again and whored after the Baals and made Baal-berith their god.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people of Israel did not remember the Lord their God, who had delivered them from the hand of all their enemies on every side,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they did not show steadfast love to the family of Jerubbaal (that is, Gideon) in return for all the good that he had done to Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Abimelech the son of Jerubbaal went to Shechem to his mother's relatives and said to them and to the whole clan of his mother's family,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Say in the ears of all the leaders of Shechem, ‘Which is better for you, that all seventy of the sons of Jerubbaal rule over you, or that one rule over you?’ Remember also that I am your bone and your flesh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his mother's relatives spoke all these words on his behalf in the ears of all the leaders of Shechem, and their hearts inclined to follow Abimelech, for they said, “He is our brother.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they gave him seventy pieces of silver out of the house of Baal-berith with which Abimelech hired worthless and reckless fellows, who followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he went to his father's house at Ophrah and killed his brothers the sons of Jerubbaal, seventy men, on one stone. But Jotham the youngest son of Jerubbaal was left, for he hid himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the leaders of Shechem came together, and all Beth-millo, and they went and made Abimelech king, by the oak of the pillar at Shechem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When it was told to Jotham, he went and stood on top of Mount Gerizim and cried aloud and said to them, “Listen to me, you leaders of Shechem, that God may listen to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The trees once went out to anoint a king over them, and they said to the olive tree, ‘Reign over us.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the olive tree said to them, ‘Shall I leave my abundance, by which gods and men are honored, and go hold sway over the trees?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the trees said to the fig tree, ‘You come and reign over us.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the fig tree said to them, ‘Shall I leave my sweetness and my good fruit and go hold sway over the trees?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the trees said to the vine, ‘You come and reign over us.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the vine said to them, ‘Shall I leave my wine that cheers God and men and go hold sway over the trees?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the trees said to the bramble, ‘You come and reign over us.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the bramble said to the trees, ‘If in good faith you are anointing me king over you, then come and take refuge in my shade, but if not, let fire come out of the bramble and devour the cedars of Lebanon.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now therefore, if you acted in good faith and integrity when you made Abimelech king, and if you have dealt well with Jerubbaal and his house and have done to him as his deeds deserved—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for my father fought for you and risked his life and delivered you from the hand of Midian,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you have risen up against my father's house this day and have killed his sons, seventy men on one stone, and have made Abimelech, the son of his female servant, king over the leaders of Shechem, because he is your relative—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if you then have acted in good faith and integrity with Jerubbaal and with his house this day, then rejoice in Abimelech, and let him also rejoice in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if not, let fire come out from Abimelech and devour the leaders of Shechem and Beth-millo; and let fire come out from the leaders of Shechem and from Beth-millo and devour Abimelech.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jotham ran away and fled and went to Beer and lived there, because of Abimelech his brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abimelech ruled over Israel three years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God sent an evil spirit between Abimelech and the leaders of Shechem, and the leaders of Shechem dealt treacherously with Abimelech,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that the violence done to the seventy sons of Jerubbaal might come, and their blood be laid on Abimelech their brother, who killed them, and on the men of Shechem, who strengthened his hands to kill his brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the leaders of Shechem put men in ambush against him on the mountaintops, and they robbed all who passed by them along that way. And it was told to Abimelech.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Gaal the son of Ebed moved into Shechem with his relatives, and the leaders of Shechem put confidence in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they went out into the field and gathered the grapes from their vineyards and trod them and held a festival; and they went into the house of their god and ate and drank and reviled Abimelech.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Gaal the son of Ebed said, “Who is Abimelech, and who are we of Shechem, that we should serve him? Is he not the son of Jerubbaal, and is not Zebul his officer? Serve the men of Hamor the father of Shechem; but why should we serve him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Would that this people were under my hand! Then I would remove Abimelech. I would say to Abimelech, ‘Increase your army, and come out.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Zebul the ruler of the city heard the words of Gaal the son of Ebed, his anger was kindled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he sent messengers to Abimelech secretly, saying, “Behold, Gaal the son of Ebed and his relatives have come to Shechem, and they are stirring up the city against you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore, go by night, you and the people who are with you, and set an ambush in the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then in the morning, as soon as the sun is up, rise early and rush upon the city. And when he and the people who are with him come out against you, you may do to them as your hand finds to do.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Abimelech and all the men who were with him rose up by night and set an ambush against Shechem in four companies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Gaal the son of Ebed went out and stood in the entrance of the gate of the city, and Abimelech and the people who were with him rose from the ambush.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Gaal saw the people, he said to Zebul, “Look, people are coming down from the mountaintops!” And Zebul said to him, “You mistake the shadow of the mountains for men.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Gaal spoke again and said, “Look, people are coming down from the center of the land, and one company is coming from the direction of the Diviners' Oak.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Zebul said to him, “Where is your mouth now, you who said, ‘Who is Abimelech, that we should serve him?’ Are not these the people whom you despised? Go out now and fight with them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Gaal went out at the head of the leaders of Shechem and fought with Abimelech.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abimelech chased him, and he fled before him. And many fell wounded, up to the entrance of the gate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abimelech lived at Arumah, and Zebul drove out Gaal and his relatives, so that they could not dwell at Shechem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the following day, the people went out into the field, and Abimelech was told.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took his people and divided them into three companies and set an ambush in the fields. And he looked and saw the people coming out of the city. So he rose against them and killed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abimelech and the company that was with him rushed forward and stood at the entrance of the gate of the city, while the two companies rushed upon all who were in the field and killed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abimelech fought against the city all that day. He captured the city and killed the people who were in it, and he razed the city and sowed it with salt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When all the leaders of the Tower of Shechem heard of it, they entered the stronghold of the house of El-berith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abimelech was told that all the leaders of the Tower of Shechem were gathered together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abimelech went up to Mount Zalmon, he and all the people who were with him. And Abimelech took an axe in his hand and cut down a bundle of brushwood and took it up and laid it on his shoulder. And he said to the men who were with him, “What you have seen me do, hurry and do as I have done.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So every one of the people cut down his bundle and following Abimelech put it against the stronghold, and they set the stronghold on fire over them, so that all the people of the Tower of Shechem also died, about 1,000 men and women.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Abimelech went to Thebez and encamped against Thebez and captured it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But there was a strong tower within the city, and all the men and women and all the leaders of the city fled to it and shut themselves in, and they went up to the roof of the tower.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abimelech came to the tower and fought against it and drew near to the door of the tower to burn it with fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a certain woman threw an upper millstone on Abimelech's head and crushed his skull.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he called quickly to the young man his armor-bearer and said to him, “Draw your sword and kill me, lest they say of me, ‘A woman killed him.’” And his young man thrust him through, and he died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the men of Israel saw that Abimelech was dead, everyone departed to his home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus God returned the evil of Abimelech, which he committed against his father in killing his seventy brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God also made all the evil of the men of Shechem return on their heads, and upon them came the curse of Jotham the son of Jerubbaal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After Abimelech there arose to save Israel Tola the son of Puah, son of Dodo, a man of Issachar, and he lived at Shamir in the hill country of Ephraim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he judged Israel twenty-three years. Then he died and was buried at Shamir.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After him arose Jair the Gileadite, who judged Israel twenty-two years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he had thirty sons who rode on thirty donkeys, and they had thirty cities, called Havvoth-jair to this day, which are in the land of Gilead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jair died and was buried in Kamon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people of Israel again did what was evil in the sight of the Lord and served the Baals and the Ashtaroth, the gods of Syria, the gods of Sidon, the gods of Moab, the gods of the Ammonites, and the gods of the Philistines. And they forsook the Lord and did not serve him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the anger of the Lord was kindled against Israel, and he sold them into the hand of the Philistines and into the hand of the Ammonites,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they crushed and oppressed the people of Israel that year. For eighteen years they oppressed all the people of Israel who were beyond the Jordan in the land of the Amorites, which is in Gilead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Ammonites crossed the Jordan to fight also against Judah and against Benjamin and against the house of Ephraim, so that Israel was severely distressed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people of Israel cried out to the Lord, saying, “We have sinned against you, because we have forsaken our God and have served the Baals.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to the people of Israel, “Did I not save you from the Egyptians and from the Amorites, from the Ammonites and from the Philistines?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Sidonians also, and the Amalekites and the Maonites oppressed you, and you cried out to me, and I saved you out of their hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet you have forsaken me and served other gods; therefore I will save you no more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go and cry out to the gods whom you have chosen; let them save you in the time of your distress.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people of Israel said to the Lord, “We have sinned; do to us whatever seems good to you. Only please deliver us this day.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they put away the foreign gods from among them and served the Lord, and he became impatient over the misery of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Ammonites were called to arms, and they encamped in Gilead. And the people of Israel came together, and they encamped at Mizpah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people, the leaders of Gilead, said one to another, “Who is the man who will begin to fight against the Ammonites? He shall be head over all the inhabitants of Gilead.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Jephthah the Gileadite was a mighty warrior, but he was the son of a prostitute. Gilead was the father of Jephthah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Gilead's wife also bore him sons. And when his wife's sons grew up, they drove Jephthah out and said to him, “You shall not have an inheritance in our father's house, for you are the son of another woman.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jephthah fled from his brothers and lived in the land of Tob, and worthless fellows collected around Jephthah and went out with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After a time the Ammonites made war against Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the Ammonites made war against Israel, the elders of Gilead went to bring Jephthah from the land of Tob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said to Jephthah, “Come and be our leader, that we may fight against the Ammonites.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jephthah said to the elders of Gilead, “Did you not hate me and drive me out of my father's house? Why have you come to me now when you are in distress?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the elders of Gilead said to Jephthah, “That is why we have turned to you now, that you may go with us and fight against the Ammonites and be our head over all the inhabitants of Gilead.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jephthah said to the elders of Gilead, “If you bring me home again to fight against the Ammonites, and the Lord gives them over to me, I will be your head.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the elders of Gilead said to Jephthah, “The Lord will be witness between us, if we do not do as you say.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jephthah went with the elders of Gilead, and the people made him head and leader over them. And Jephthah spoke all his words before the Lord at Mizpah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jephthah sent messengers to the king of the Ammonites and said, “What do you have against me, that you have come to me to fight against my land?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the king of the Ammonites answered the messengers of Jephthah, “Because Israel on coming up from Egypt took away my land, from the Arnon to the Jabbok and to the Jordan; now therefore restore it peaceably.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jephthah again sent messengers to the king of the Ammonites
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to him, “Thus says Jephthah: Israel did not take away the land of Moab or the land of the Ammonites,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but when they came up from Egypt, Israel went through the wilderness to the Red Sea and came to Kadesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Israel then sent messengers to the king of Edom, saying, ‘Please let us pass through your land,’ but the king of Edom would not listen. And they sent also to the king of Moab, but he would not consent. So Israel remained at Kadesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then they journeyed through the wilderness and went around the land of Edom and the land of Moab and arrived on the east side of the land of Moab and camped on the other side of the Arnon. But they did not enter the territory of Moab, for the Arnon was the boundary of Moab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Israel then sent messengers to Sihon king of the Amorites, king of Heshbon, and Israel said to him, ‘Please let us pass through your land to our country,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but Sihon did not trust Israel to pass through his territory, so Sihon gathered all his people together and encamped at Jahaz and fought with Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord, the God of Israel, gave Sihon and all his people into the hand of Israel, and they defeated them. So Israel took possession of all the land of the Amorites, who inhabited that country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they took possession of all the territory of the Amorites from the Arnon to the Jabbok and from the wilderness to the Jordan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then the Lord, the God of Israel, dispossessed the Amorites from before his people Israel; and are you to take possession of them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Will you not possess what Chemosh your god gives you to possess? And all that the Lord our God has dispossessed before us, we will possess.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now are you any better than Balak the son of Zippor, king of Moab? Did he ever contend against Israel, or did he ever go to war with them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While Israel lived in Heshbon and its villages, and in Aroer and its villages, and in all the cities that are on the banks of the Arnon, 300 years, why did you not deliver them within that time?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I therefore have not sinned against you, and you do me wrong by making war on me. The Lord, the Judge, decide this day between the people of Israel and the people of Ammon.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the king of the Ammonites did not listen to the words of Jephthah that he sent to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Spirit of the Lord was upon Jephthah, and he passed through Gilead and Manasseh and passed on to Mizpah of Gilead, and from Mizpah of Gilead he passed on to the Ammonites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jephthah made a vow to the Lord and said, “If you will give the Ammonites into my hand,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then whatever comes out from the doors of my house to meet me when I return in peace from the Ammonites shall be the Lord's, and I will offer it up for a burnt offering.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jephthah crossed over to the Ammonites to fight against them, and the Lord gave them into his hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he struck them from Aroer to the neighborhood of Minnith, twenty cities, and as far as Abel-keramim, with a great blow. So the Ammonites were subdued before the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jephthah came to his home at Mizpah. And behold, his daughter came out to meet him with tambourines and with dances. She was his only child; besides her he had neither son nor daughter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as soon as he saw her, he tore his clothes and said, “Alas, my daughter! You have brought me very low, and you have become the cause of great trouble to me. For I have opened my mouth to the Lord, and I cannot take back my vow.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she said to him, “My father, you have opened your mouth to the Lord; do to me according to what has gone out of your mouth, now that the Lord has avenged you on your enemies, on the Ammonites.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So she said to her father, “Let this thing be done for me: leave me alone two months, that I may go up and down on the mountains and weep for my virginity, I and my companions.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he said, “Go.” Then he sent her away for two months, and she departed, she and her companions, and wept for her virginity on the mountains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And at the end of two months, she returned to her father, who did with her according to his vow that he had made. She had never known a man, and it became a custom in Israel
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that the daughters of Israel went year by year to lament the daughter of Jephthah the Gileadite four days in the year.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men of Ephraim were called to arms, and they crossed to Zaphon and said to Jephthah, “Why did you cross over to fight against the Ammonites and did not call us to go with you? We will burn your house over you with fire.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jephthah said to them, “I and my people had a great dispute with the Ammonites, and when I called you, you did not save me from their hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when I saw that you would not save me, I took my life in my hand and crossed over against the Ammonites, and the Lord gave them into my hand. Why then have you come up to me this day to fight against me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jephthah gathered all the men of Gilead and fought with Ephraim. And the men of Gilead struck Ephraim, because they said, “You are fugitives of Ephraim, you Gileadites, in the midst of Ephraim and Manasseh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Gileadites captured the fords of the Jordan against the Ephraimites. And when any of the fugitives of Ephraim said, “Let me go over,” the men of Gilead said to him, “Are you an Ephraimite?” When he said, “No,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they said to him, “Then say Shibboleth,” and he said, “Sibboleth,” for he could not pronounce it right. Then they seized him and slaughtered him at the fords of the Jordan. At that time 42,000 of the Ephraimites fell.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jephthah judged Israel six years. Then Jephthah the Gileadite died and was buried in his city in Gilead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After him Ibzan of Bethlehem judged Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He had thirty sons, and thirty daughters he gave in marriage outside his clan, and thirty daughters he brought in from outside for his sons. And he judged Israel seven years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Ibzan died and was buried at Bethlehem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After him Elon the Zebulunite judged Israel, and he judged Israel ten years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Elon the Zebulunite died and was buried at Aijalon in the land of Zebulun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After him Abdon the son of Hillel the Pirathonite judged Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He had forty sons and thirty grandsons, who rode on seventy donkeys, and he judged Israel eight years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Abdon the son of Hillel the Pirathonite died and was buried at Pirathon in the land of Ephraim, in the hill country of the Amalekites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people of Israel again did what was evil in the sight of the Lord, so the Lord gave them into the hand of the Philistines for forty years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was a certain man of Zorah, of the tribe of the Danites, whose name was Manoah. And his wife was barren and had no children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the angel of the Lord appeared to the woman and said to her, “Behold, you are barren and have not borne children, but you shall conceive and bear a son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore be careful and drink no wine or strong drink, and eat nothing unclean,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for behold, you shall conceive and bear a son. No razor shall come upon his head, for the child shall be a Nazirite to God from the womb, and he shall begin to save Israel from the hand of the Philistines.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the woman came and told her husband, “A man of God came to me, and his appearance was like the appearance of the angel of God, very awesome. I did not ask him where he was from, and he did not tell me his name,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but he said to me, ‘Behold, you shall conceive and bear a son. So then drink no wine or strong drink, and eat nothing unclean, for the child shall be a Nazirite to God from the womb to the day of his death.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Manoah prayed to the Lord and said, “O Lord, please let the man of God whom you sent come again to us and teach us what we are to do with the child who will be born.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God listened to the voice of Manoah, and the angel of God came again to the woman as she sat in the field. But Manoah her husband was not with her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the woman ran quickly and told her husband, “Behold, the man who came to me the other day has appeared to me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Manoah arose and went after his wife and came to the man and said to him, “Are you the man who spoke to this woman?” And he said, “I am.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Manoah said, “Now when your words come true, what is to be the child's manner of life, and what is his mission?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the angel of the Lord said to Manoah, “Of all that I said to the woman let her be careful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She may not eat of anything that comes from the vine, neither let her drink wine or strong drink, or eat any unclean thing. All that I commanded her let her observe.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Manoah said to the angel of the Lord, “Please let us detain you and prepare a young goat for you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the angel of the Lord said to Manoah, “If you detain me, I will not eat of your food. But if you prepare a burnt offering, then offer it to the Lord.” (For Manoah did not know that he was the angel of the Lord.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Manoah said to the angel of the Lord, “What is your name, so that, when your words come true, we may honor you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the angel of the Lord said to him, “Why do you ask my name, seeing it is wonderful?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Manoah took the young goat with the grain offering, and offered it on the rock to the Lord, to the one who works wonders, and Manoah and his wife were watching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the flame went up toward heaven from the altar, the angel of the Lord went up in the flame of the altar. Now Manoah and his wife were watching, and they fell on their faces to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel of the Lord appeared no more to Manoah and to his wife. Then Manoah knew that he was the angel of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Manoah said to his wife, “We shall surely die, for we have seen God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But his wife said to him, “If the Lord had meant to kill us, he would not have accepted a burnt offering and a grain offering at our hands, or shown us all these things, or now announced to us such things as these.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the woman bore a son and called his name Samson. And the young man grew, and the Lord blessed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Spirit of the Lord began to stir him in Mahaneh-dan, between Zorah and Eshtaol.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Samson went down to Timnah, and at Timnah he saw one of the daughters of the Philistines.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he came up and told his father and mother, “I saw one of the daughters of the Philistines at Timnah. Now get her for me as my wife.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But his father and mother said to him, “Is there not a woman among the daughters of your relatives, or among all our people, that you must go to take a wife from the uncircumcised Philistines?” But Samson said to his father, “Get her for me, for she is right in my eyes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His father and mother did not know that it was from the Lord, for he was seeking an opportunity against the Philistines. At that time the Philistines ruled over Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Samson went down with his father and mother to Timnah, and they came to the vineyards of Timnah. And behold, a young lion came toward him roaring.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Spirit of the Lord rushed upon him, and although he had nothing in his hand, he tore the lion in pieces as one tears a young goat. But he did not tell his father or his mother what he had done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he went down and talked with the woman, and she was right in Samson's eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After some days he returned to take her. And he turned aside to see the carcass of the lion, and behold, there was a swarm of bees in the body of the lion, and honey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He scraped it out into his hands and went on, eating as he went. And he came to his father and mother and gave some to them, and they ate. But he did not tell them that he had scraped the honey from the carcass of the lion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His father went down to the woman, and Samson prepared a feast there, for so the young men used to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as the people saw him, they brought thirty companions to be with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Samson said to them, “Let me now put a riddle to you. If you can tell me what it is, within the seven days of the feast, and find it out, then I will give you thirty linen garments and thirty changes of clothes,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but if you cannot tell me what it is, then you shall give me thirty linen garments and thirty changes of clothes.” And they said to him, “Put your riddle, that we may hear it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he said to them,
“Out of the eater came something to eat.
Out of the strong came something sweet.”
And in three days they could not solve the riddle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the fourth day they said to Samson's wife, “Entice your husband to tell us what the riddle is, lest we burn you and your father's house with fire. Have you invited us here to impoverish us?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Samson's wife wept over him and said, “You only hate me; you do not love me. You have put a riddle to my people, and you have not told me what it is.” And he said to her, “Behold, I have not told my father nor my mother, and shall I tell you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She wept before him the seven days that their feast lasted, and on the seventh day he told her, because she pressed him hard. Then she told the riddle to her people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And the men of the city said to him on the seventh day before the sun went down,
“What is sweeter than honey?
What is stronger than a lion?”
And he said to them,
“If you had not plowed with my heifer,
you would not have found out my riddle.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Spirit of the Lord rushed upon him, and he went down to Ashkelon and struck down thirty men of the town and took their spoil and gave the garments to those who had told the riddle. In hot anger he went back to his father's house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Samson's wife was given to his companion, who had been his best man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After some days, at the time of wheat harvest, Samson went to visit his wife with a young goat. And he said, “I will go in to my wife in the chamber.” But her father would not allow him to go in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And her father said, “I really thought that you utterly hated her, so I gave her to your companion. Is not her younger sister more beautiful than she? Please take her instead.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Samson said to them, “This time I shall be innocent in regard to the Philistines, when I do them harm.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Samson went and caught 300 foxes and took torches. And he turned them tail to tail and put a torch between each pair of tails.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had set fire to the torches, he let the foxes go into the standing grain of the Philistines and set fire to the stacked grain and the standing grain, as well as the olive orchards.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Philistines said, “Who has done this?” And they said, “Samson, the son-in-law of the Timnite, because he has taken his wife and given her to his companion.” And the Philistines came up and burned her and her father with fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Samson said to them, “If this is what you do, I swear I will be avenged on you, and after that I will quit.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he struck them hip and thigh with a great blow, and he went down and stayed in the cleft of the rock of Etam.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Philistines came up and encamped in Judah and made a raid on Lehi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the men of Judah said, “Why have you come up against us?” They said, “We have come up to bind Samson, to do to him as he did to us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
