verses.text: Then 3,000 men of Judah went down to the cleft of the rock of Etam, and said to Samson, “Do you not know that the Philistines are rulers over us? What then is this that you have done to us?” And he said to them, “As they did to me, so have I done to them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said to him, “We have come down to bind you, that we may give you into the hands of the Philistines.” And Samson said to them, “Swear to me that you will not attack me yourselves.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to him, “No; we will only bind you and give you into their hands. We will surely not kill you.” So they bound him with two new ropes and brought him up from the rock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he came to Lehi, the Philistines came shouting to meet him. Then the Spirit of the Lord rushed upon him, and the ropes that were on his arms became as flax that has caught fire, and his bonds melted off his hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he found a fresh jawbone of a donkey, and put out his hand and took it, and with it he struck 1,000 men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And Samson said,
“With the jawbone of a donkey,
    heaps upon heaps,
with the jawbone of a donkey
    have I struck down a thousand men.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as he had finished speaking, he threw away the jawbone out of his hand. And that place was called Ramath-lehi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he was very thirsty, and he called upon the Lord and said, “You have granted this great salvation by the hand of your servant, and shall I now die of thirst and fall into the hands of the uncircumcised?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God split open the hollow place that is at Lehi, and water came out from it. And when he drank, his spirit returned, and he revived. Therefore the name of it was called En-hakkore; it is at Lehi to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he judged Israel in the days of the Philistines twenty years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Samson went to Gaza, and there he saw a prostitute, and he went in to her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Gazites were told, “Samson has come here.” And they surrounded the place and set an ambush for him all night at the gate of the city. They kept quiet all night, saying, “Let us wait till the light of the morning; then we will kill him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Samson lay till midnight, and at midnight he arose and took hold of the doors of the gate of the city and the two posts, and pulled them up, bar and all, and put them on his shoulders and carried them to the top of the hill that is in front of Hebron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this he loved a woman in the Valley of Sorek, whose name was Delilah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the lords of the Philistines came up to her and said to her, “Seduce him, and see where his great strength lies, and by what means we may overpower him, that we may bind him to humble him. And we will each give you 1,100 pieces of silver.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Delilah said to Samson, “Please tell me where your great strength lies, and how you might be bound, that one could subdue you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Samson said to her, “If they bind me with seven fresh bowstrings that have not been dried, then I shall become weak and be like any other man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the lords of the Philistines brought up to her seven fresh bowstrings that had not been dried, and she bound him with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now she had men lying in ambush in an inner chamber. And she said to him, “The Philistines are upon you, Samson!” But he snapped the bowstrings, as a thread of flax snaps when it touches the fire. So the secret of his strength was not known.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Delilah said to Samson, “Behold, you have mocked me and told me lies. Please tell me how you might be bound.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to her, “If they bind me with new ropes that have not been used, then I shall become weak and be like any other man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Delilah took new ropes and bound him with them and said to him, “The Philistines are upon you, Samson!” And the men lying in ambush were in an inner chamber. But he snapped the ropes off his arms like a thread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Delilah said to Samson, “Until now you have mocked me and told me lies. Tell me how you might be bound.” And he said to her, “If you weave the seven locks of my head with the web and fasten it tight with the pin, then I shall become weak and be like any other man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So while he slept, Delilah took the seven locks of his head and wove them into the web. And she made them tight with the pin and said to him, “The Philistines are upon you, Samson!” But he awoke from his sleep and pulled away the pin, the loom, and the web.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she said to him, “How can you say, ‘I love you,’ when your heart is not with me? You have mocked me these three times, and you have not told me where your great strength lies.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when she pressed him hard with her words day after day, and urged him, his soul was vexed to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he told her all his heart, and said to her, “A razor has never come upon my head, for I have been a Nazirite to God from my mother's womb. If my head is shaved, then my strength will leave me, and I shall become weak and be like any other man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Delilah saw that he had told her all his heart, she sent and called the lords of the Philistines, saying, “Come up again, for he has told me all his heart.” Then the lords of the Philistines came up to her and brought the money in their hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She made him sleep on her knees. And she called a man and had him shave off the seven locks of his head. Then she began to torment him, and his strength left him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she said, “The Philistines are upon you, Samson!” And he awoke from his sleep and said, “I will go out as at other times and shake myself free.” But he did not know that the Lord had left him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Philistines seized him and gouged out his eyes and brought him down to Gaza and bound him with bronze shackles. And he ground at the mill in the prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the hair of his head began to grow again after it had been shaved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the lords of the Philistines gathered to offer a great sacrifice to Dagon their god and to rejoice, and they said, “Our god has given Samson our enemy into our hand.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the people saw him, they praised their god. For they said, “Our god has given our enemy into our hand, the ravager of our country, who has killed many of us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when their hearts were merry, they said, “Call Samson, that he may entertain us.” So they called Samson out of the prison, and he entertained them. They made him stand between the pillars.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Samson said to the young man who held him by the hand, “Let me feel the pillars on which the house rests, that I may lean against them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the house was full of men and women. All the lords of the Philistines were there, and on the roof there were about 3,000 men and women, who looked on while Samson entertained.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Samson called to the Lord and said, “O Lord God, please remember me and please strengthen me only this once, O God, that I may be avenged on the Philistines for my two eyes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Samson grasped the two middle pillars on which the house rested, and he leaned his weight against them, his right hand on the one and his left hand on the other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Samson said, “Let me die with the Philistines.” Then he bowed with all his strength, and the house fell upon the lords and upon all the people who were in it. So the dead whom he killed at his death were more than those whom he had killed during his life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then his brothers and all his family came down and took him and brought him up and buried him between Zorah and Eshtaol in the tomb of Manoah his father. He had judged Israel twenty years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was a man of the hill country of Ephraim, whose name was Micah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to his mother, “The 1,100 pieces of silver that were taken from you, about which you uttered a curse, and also spoke it in my ears, behold, the silver is with me; I took it.” And his mother said, “Blessed be my son by the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he restored the 1,100 pieces of silver to his mother. And his mother said, “I dedicate the silver to the Lord from my hand for my son, to make a carved image and a metal image. Now therefore I will restore it to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when he restored the money to his mother, his mother took 200 pieces of silver and gave it to the silversmith, who made it into a carved image and a metal image. And it was in the house of Micah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the man Micah had a shrine, and he made an ephod and household gods, and ordained one of his sons, who became his priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In those days there was no king in Israel. Everyone did what was right in his own eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there was a young man of Bethlehem in Judah, of the family of Judah, who was a Levite, and he sojourned there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the man departed from the town of Bethlehem in Judah to sojourn where he could find a place. And as he journeyed, he came to the hill country of Ephraim to the house of Micah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Micah said to him, “Where do you come from?” And he said to him, “I am a Levite of Bethlehem in Judah, and I am going to sojourn where I may find a place.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Micah said to him, “Stay with me, and be to me a father and a priest, and I will give you ten pieces of silver a year and a suit of clothes and your living.” And the Levite went in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Levite was content to dwell with the man, and the young man became to him like one of his sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Micah ordained the Levite, and the young man became his priest, and was in the house of Micah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Micah said, “Now I know that the Lord will prosper me, because I have a Levite as priest.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In those days there was no king in Israel. And in those days the tribe of the people of Dan was seeking for itself an inheritance to dwell in, for until then no inheritance among the tribes of Israel had fallen to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the people of Dan sent five able men from the whole number of their tribe, from Zorah and from Eshtaol, to spy out the land and to explore it. And they said to them, “Go and explore the land.” And they came to the hill country of Ephraim, to the house of Micah, and lodged there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they were by the house of Micah, they recognized the voice of the young Levite. And they turned aside and said to him, “Who brought you here? What are you doing in this place? What is your business here?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “This is how Micah dealt with me: he has hired me, and I have become his priest.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said to him, “Inquire of God, please, that we may know whether the journey on which we are setting out will succeed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the priest said to them, “Go in peace. The journey on which you go is under the eye of the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the five men departed and came to Laish and saw the people who were there, how they lived in security, after the manner of the Sidonians, quiet and unsuspecting, lacking nothing that is in the earth and possessing wealth, and how they were far from the Sidonians and had no dealings with anyone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they came to their brothers at Zorah and Eshtaol, their brothers said to them, “What do you report?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said, “Arise, and let us go up against them, for we have seen the land, and behold, it is very good. And will you do nothing? Do not be slow to go, to enter in and possess the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as you go, you will come to an unsuspecting people. The land is spacious, for God has given it into your hands, a place where there is no lack of anything that is in the earth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So 600 men of the tribe of Dan, armed with weapons of war, set out from Zorah and Eshtaol,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and went up and encamped at Kiriath-jearim in Judah. On this account that place is called Mahaneh-dan to this day; behold, it is west of Kiriath-jearim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they passed on from there to the hill country of Ephraim, and came to the house of Micah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the five men who had gone to scout out the country of Laish said to their brothers, “Do you know that in these houses there are an ephod, household gods, a carved image, and a metal image? Now therefore consider what you will do.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they turned aside there and came to the house of the young Levite, at the home of Micah, and asked him about his welfare.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the 600 men of the Danites, armed with their weapons of war, stood by the entrance of the gate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the five men who had gone to scout out the land went up and entered and took the carved image, the ephod, the household gods, and the metal image, while the priest stood by the entrance of the gate with the 600 men armed with weapons of war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when these went into Micah's house and took the carved image, the ephod, the household gods, and the metal image, the priest said to them, “What are you doing?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said to him, “Keep quiet; put your hand on your mouth and come with us and be to us a father and a priest. Is it better for you to be priest to the house of one man, or to be priest to a tribe and clan in Israel?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the priest's heart was glad. He took the ephod and the household gods and the carved image and went along with the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they turned and departed, putting the little ones and the livestock and the goods in front of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had gone a distance from the home of Micah, the men who were in the houses near Micah's house were called out, and they overtook the people of Dan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they shouted to the people of Dan, who turned around and said to Micah, “What is the matter with you, that you come with such a company?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “You take my gods that I made and the priest, and go away, and what have I left? How then do you ask me, ‘What is the matter with you?’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people of Dan said to him, “Do not let your voice be heard among us, lest angry fellows fall upon you, and you lose your life with the lives of your household.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the people of Dan went their way. And when Micah saw that they were too strong for him, he turned and went back to his home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the people of Dan took what Micah had made, and the priest who belonged to him, and they came to Laish, to a people quiet and unsuspecting, and struck them with the edge of the sword and burned the city with fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was no deliverer because it was far from Sidon, and they had no dealings with anyone. It was in the valley that belongs to Beth-rehob. Then they rebuilt the city and lived in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they named the city Dan, after the name of Dan their ancestor, who was born to Israel; but the name of the city was Laish at the first.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people of Dan set up the carved image for themselves, and Jonathan the son of Gershom, son of Moses, and his sons were priests to the tribe of the Danites until the day of the captivity of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they set up Micah's carved image that he made, as long as the house of God was at Shiloh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In those days, when there was no king in Israel, a certain Levite was sojourning in the remote parts of the hill country of Ephraim, who took to himself a concubine from Bethlehem in Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his concubine was unfaithful to him, and she went away from him to her father's house at Bethlehem in Judah, and was there some four months.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then her husband arose and went after her, to speak kindly to her and bring her back. He had with him his servant and a couple of donkeys. And she brought him into her father's house. And when the girl's father saw him, he came with joy to meet him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his father-in-law, the girl's father, made him stay, and he remained with him three days. So they ate and drank and spent the night there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on the fourth day they arose early in the morning, and he prepared to go, but the girl's father said to his son-in-law, “Strengthen your heart with a morsel of bread, and after that you may go.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the two of them sat and ate and drank together. And the girl's father said to the man, “Be pleased to spend the night, and let your heart be merry.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the man rose up to go, his father-in-law pressed him, till he spent the night there again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on the fifth day he arose early in the morning to depart. And the girl's father said, “Strengthen your heart and wait until the day declines.” So they ate, both of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the man and his concubine and his servant rose up to depart, his father-in-law, the girl's father, said to him, “Behold, now the day has waned toward evening. Please, spend the night. Behold, the day draws to its close. Lodge here and let your heart be merry, and tomorrow you shall arise early in the morning for your journey, and go home.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the man would not spend the night. He rose up and departed and arrived opposite Jebus (that is, Jerusalem). He had with him a couple of saddled donkeys, and his concubine was with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they were near Jebus, the day was nearly over, and the servant said to his master, “Come now, let us turn aside to this city of the Jebusites and spend the night in it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his master said to him, “We will not turn aside into the city of foreigners, who do not belong to the people of Israel, but we will pass on to Gibeah.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to his young man, “Come and let us draw near to one of these places and spend the night at Gibeah or at Ramah.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they passed on and went their way. And the sun went down on them near Gibeah, which belongs to Benjamin,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they turned aside there, to go in and spend the night at Gibeah. And he went in and sat down in the open square of the city, for no one took them into his house to spend the night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, an old man was coming from his work in the field at evening. The man was from the hill country of Ephraim, and he was sojourning in Gibeah. The men of the place were Benjaminites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he lifted up his eyes and saw the traveler in the open square of the city. And the old man said, “Where are you going? And where do you come from?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to him, “We are passing from Bethlehem in Judah to the remote parts of the hill country of Ephraim, from which I come. I went to Bethlehem in Judah, and I am going to the house of the Lord, but no one has taken me into his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We have straw and feed for our donkeys, with bread and wine for me and your female servant and the young man with your servants. There is no lack of anything.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the old man said, “Peace be to you; I will care for all your wants. Only, do not spend the night in the square.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he brought him into his house and gave the donkeys feed. And they washed their feet, and ate and drank.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they were making their hearts merry, behold, the men of the city, worthless fellows, surrounded the house, beating on the door. And they said to the old man, the master of the house, “Bring out the man who came into your house, that we may know him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the man, the master of the house, went out to them and said to them, “No, my brothers, do not act so wickedly; since this man has come into my house, do not do this vile thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, here are my virgin daughter and his concubine. Let me bring them out now. Violate them and do with them what seems good to you, but against this man do not do this outrageous thing.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the men would not listen to him. So the man seized his concubine and made her go out to them. And they knew her and abused her all night until the morning. And as the dawn began to break, they let her go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as morning appeared, the woman came and fell down at the door of the man's house where her master was, until it was light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And her master rose up in the morning, and when he opened the doors of the house and went out to go on his way, behold, there was his concubine lying at the door of the house, with her hands on the threshold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to her, “Get up, let us be going.” But there was no answer. Then he put her on the donkey, and the man rose up and went away to his home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he entered his house, he took a knife, and taking hold of his concubine he divided her, limb by limb, into twelve pieces, and sent her throughout all the territory of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all who saw it said, “Such a thing has never happened or been seen from the day that the people of Israel came up out of the land of Egypt until this day; consider it, take counsel, and speak.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the people of Israel came out, from Dan to Beersheba, including the land of Gilead, and the congregation assembled as one man to the Lord at Mizpah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the chiefs of all the people, of all the tribes of Israel, presented themselves in the assembly of the people of God, 400,000 men on foot that drew the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now the people of Benjamin heard that the people of Israel had gone up to Mizpah.) And the people of Israel said, “Tell us, how did this evil happen?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Levite, the husband of the woman who was murdered, answered and said, “I came to Gibeah that belongs to Benjamin, I and my concubine, to spend the night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the leaders of Gibeah rose against me and surrounded the house against me by night. They meant to kill me, and they violated my concubine, and she is dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I took hold of my concubine and cut her in pieces and sent her throughout all the country of the inheritance of Israel, for they have committed abomination and outrage in Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, you people of Israel, all of you, give your advice and counsel here.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the people arose as one man, saying, “None of us will go to his tent, and none of us will return to his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now this is what we will do to Gibeah: we will go up against it by lot,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and we will take ten men of a hundred throughout all the tribes of Israel, and a hundred of a thousand, and a thousand of ten thousand, to bring provisions for the people, that when they come they may repay Gibeah of Benjamin for all the outrage that they have committed in Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So all the men of Israel gathered against the city, united as one man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the tribes of Israel sent men through all the tribe of Benjamin, saying, “What evil is this that has taken place among you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore give up the men, the worthless fellows in Gibeah, that we may put them to death and purge evil from Israel.” But the Benjaminites would not listen to the voice of their brothers, the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the people of Benjamin came together out of the cities to Gibeah to go out to battle against the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people of Benjamin mustered out of their cities on that day 26,000 men who drew the sword, besides the inhabitants of Gibeah, who mustered 700 chosen men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Among all these were 700 chosen men who were left-handed; every one could sling a stone at a hair and not miss.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the men of Israel, apart from Benjamin, mustered 400,000 men who drew the sword; all these were men of war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people of Israel arose and went up to Bethel and inquired of God, “Who shall go up first for us to fight against the people of Benjamin?” And the Lord said, “Judah shall go up first.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the people of Israel rose in the morning and encamped against Gibeah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the men of Israel went out to fight against Benjamin, and the men of Israel drew up the battle line against them at Gibeah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people of Benjamin came out of Gibeah and destroyed on that day 22,000 men of the Israelites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the people, the men of Israel, took courage, and again formed the battle line in the same place where they had formed it on the first day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people of Israel went up and wept before the Lord until the evening. And they inquired of the Lord, “Shall we again draw near to fight against our brothers, the people of Benjamin?” And the Lord said, “Go up against them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the people of Israel came near against the people of Benjamin the second day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Benjamin went against them out of Gibeah the second day, and destroyed 18,000 men of the people of Israel. All these were men who drew the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the people of Israel, the whole army, went up and came to Bethel and wept. They sat there before the Lord and fasted that day until evening, and offered burnt offerings and peace offerings before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people of Israel inquired of the Lord (for the ark of the covenant of God was there in those days,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Phinehas the son of Eleazar, son of Aaron, ministered before it in those days), saying, “Shall we go out once more to battle against our brothers, the people of Benjamin, or shall we cease?” And the Lord said, “Go up, for tomorrow I will give them into your hand.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Israel set men in ambush around Gibeah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people of Israel went up against the people of Benjamin on the third day and set themselves in array against Gibeah, as at other times.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people of Benjamin went out against the people and were drawn away from the city. And as at other times they began to strike and kill some of the people in the highways, one of which goes up to Bethel and the other to Gibeah, and in the open country, about thirty men of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people of Benjamin said, “They are routed before us, as at the first.” But the people of Israel said, “Let us flee and draw them away from the city to the highways.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the men of Israel rose up out of their place and set themselves in array at Baal-tamar, and the men of Israel who were in ambush rushed out of their place from Maareh-geba.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there came against Gibeah 10,000 chosen men out of all Israel, and the battle was hard, but the Benjaminites did not know that disaster was close upon them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord defeated Benjamin before Israel, and the people of Israel destroyed 25,100 men of Benjamin that day. All these were men who drew the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So the people of Benjamin saw that they were defeated.
The men of Israel gave ground to Benjamin, because they trusted the men in ambush whom they had set against Gibeah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the men in ambush hurried and rushed against Gibeah; the men in ambush moved out and struck all the city with the edge of the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the appointed signal between the men of Israel and the men in the main ambush was that when they made a great cloud of smoke rise up out of the city
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the men of Israel should turn in battle. Now Benjamin had begun to strike and kill about thirty men of Israel. They said, “Surely they are defeated before us, as in the first battle.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the signal began to rise out of the city in a column of smoke, the Benjaminites looked behind them, and behold, the whole of the city went up in smoke to heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the men of Israel turned, and the men of Benjamin were dismayed, for they saw that disaster was close upon them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore they turned their backs before the men of Israel in the direction of the wilderness, but the battle overtook them. And those who came out of the cities were destroying them in their midst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Surrounding the Benjaminites, they pursued them and trod them down from Nohah as far as opposite Gibeah on the east.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eighteen thousand men of Benjamin fell, all of them men of valor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they turned and fled toward the wilderness to the rock of Rimmon. Five thousand men of them were cut down in the highways. And they were pursued hard to Gidom, and 2,000 men of them were struck down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So all who fell that day of Benjamin were 25,000 men who drew the sword, all of them men of valor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But 600 men turned and fled toward the wilderness to the rock of Rimmon and remained at the rock of Rimmon four months.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the men of Israel turned back against the people of Benjamin and struck them with the edge of the sword, the city, men and beasts and all that they found. And all the towns that they found they set on fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the men of Israel had sworn at Mizpah, “No one of us shall give his daughter in marriage to Benjamin.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people came to Bethel and sat there till evening before God, and they lifted up their voices and wept bitterly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said, “O Lord, the God of Israel, why has this happened in Israel, that today there should be one tribe lacking in Israel?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the next day the people rose early and built there an altar and offered burnt offerings and peace offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people of Israel said, “Which of all the tribes of Israel did not come up in the assembly to the Lord?” For they had taken a great oath concerning him who did not come up to the Lord to Mizpah, saying, “He shall surely be put to death.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people of Israel had compassion for Benjamin their brother and said, “One tribe is cut off from Israel this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What shall we do for wives for those who are left, since we have sworn by the Lord that we will not give them any of our daughters for wives?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said, “What one is there of the tribes of Israel that did not come up to the Lord to Mizpah?” And behold, no one had come to the camp from Jabesh-gilead, to the assembly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For when the people were mustered, behold, not one of the inhabitants of Jabesh-gilead was there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the congregation sent 12,000 of their bravest men there and commanded them, “Go and strike the inhabitants of Jabesh-gilead with the edge of the sword; also the women and the little ones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what you shall do: every male and every woman that has lain with a male you shall devote to destruction.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they found among the inhabitants of Jabesh-gilead 400 young virgins who had not known a man by lying with him, and they brought them to the camp at Shiloh, which is in the land of Canaan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the whole congregation sent word to the people of Benjamin who were at the rock of Rimmon and proclaimed peace to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Benjamin returned at that time. And they gave them the women whom they had saved alive of the women of Jabesh-gilead, but they were not enough for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people had compassion on Benjamin because the Lord had made a breach in the tribes of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the elders of the congregation said, “What shall we do for wives for those who are left, since the women are destroyed out of Benjamin?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said, “There must be an inheritance for the survivors of Benjamin, that a tribe not be blotted out from Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet we cannot give them wives from our daughters.” For the people of Israel had sworn, “Cursed be he who gives a wife to Benjamin.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they said, “Behold, there is the yearly feast of the Lord at Shiloh, which is north of Bethel, on the east of the highway that goes up from Bethel to Shechem, and south of Lebonah.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they commanded the people of Benjamin, saying, “Go and lie in ambush in the vineyards
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and watch. If the daughters of Shiloh come out to dance in the dances, then come out of the vineyards and snatch each man his wife from the daughters of Shiloh, and go to the land of Benjamin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when their fathers or their brothers come to complain to us, we will say to them, ‘Grant them graciously to us, because we did not take for each man of them his wife in battle, neither did you give them to them, else you would now be guilty.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people of Benjamin did so and took their wives, according to their number, from the dancers whom they carried off. Then they went and returned to their inheritance and rebuilt the towns and lived in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people of Israel departed from there at that time, every man to his tribe and family, and they went out from there every man to his inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In those days there was no king in Israel. Everyone did what was right in his own eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator
